what: data from the ASQ-3 study from CADI-UMAG
title: data from the ASQ-3 study from CADI-UMAG
text: purpose {ASQ3} package provide access data collected Centro Asistencial Docente e Investigación de la Universidad de Magallanes (CADI-UMAG). data treated, eliminating sensitive information compromise identity participants linked individuals. Data preparation process can seen .

text: can install development version ASQ3 GitHub :

title: data from the ASQ-3 study from CADI-UMAG
text: basic example shows use dataset  console. information dataset, can consult dataset documentation.
code: library(ASQ3) # Load the package  head(dataset[, 1:4], n = 5) # Print the first 5 rows of the first 4 columns #>    profesional_id profesional_especialidad paciente_id      sexo #> 1:              2               Enfermeria           1 Masculino #> 2:              2               Enfermeria           2 Masculino #> 3:              3             Kinesiologia           3  Femenino #> 4:              3             Kinesiologia           4 Masculino #> 5:              3             Kinesiologia           5 Masculino

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: dataset preparation process occurs several steps, involve manual processing data using Excel programmatic preparation using R. programmatic part steps used data treatment detailed .

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: original data available package, given sensitive nature information, requests ignored rejected.

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: data entry using Excel complete, imported R using read_excel function readxl package.  Subsequently, column names changed syntactically valid versions, case camel case (e.g. "Column " "column_a").  completed, data transformed `data.table' format, allows efficient implementation function (functions) across multiple columns (using selection criteria greater precision).

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: import complete, proceeded standardise formatting columns using regular expressions (RegEx) select columns, starting modification text variables.  perform similar process numeric date variables, assigning necessary properties analysed later.
code: col_names <- names(dataset) # for later use  # Labels to "title-case" ind <- grep("nombre|interpretacion|especialidad", col_names, value = TRUE) dataset[, (ind) := lapply(.SD, stringr::str_to_title), .SDcols = ind]  # Labels to "lower-case" ind <- grep("agrupacion|diagnostico", col_names, value = TRUE) dataset[, (ind) := lapply(.SD, tolower), .SDcols = ind] # numerical variables ind <- grep("total", col_names, value = TRUE) dataset[, (ind) := lapply(.SD, as.numeric), .SDcols = ind]  # asq3_meses to numeric dataset[, asq3_meses := as.numeric(x = gsub("MESES", "", asq3_meses))]  # Processing dates ind <- grep("fecha", col_names, value = TRUE) dataset[, (ind) := lapply(.SD, data.table::as.IDate), .SDcols = ind]

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: order treat maintain confidentiality identity patients, well evaluating professionals, identifying number assigned individual, excluding process RUT name missing (.e. missing data).
code: # Drop missing values dataset <- dataset[!is.na(rut_2) & !is.na(paciente_nombre)]  # ID for each professional dataset[, profesional_id := as.numeric(x = factor(profesional_nombre))] # and then we eliminate the column with their name dataset[, profesional_nombre := NULL]  # ID for each patient dataset[, paciente_id := as.numeric(x = factor(paciente_nombre))] # and then we eliminate the column with their name dataset[, paciente_nombre := NULL] # and the the column with their RUT dataset[, `:=`(rut_1 = NULL, rut_2 = NULL)]  # Also eliminate the column with the responder's name dataset[, respondedor_nombre := NULL]

title: Data preparation process — data-prep
text: raw data, age patients months weeks prematurity, allows us calculate corrected age patients months, latter calculated using auxiliary function.
code: # Custom function edad_corregida <- function(x, y) {   # standardize number of weeks in a month   weeks_in_a_month <- 4.34524    # Months old to weeks old   weeks_old <- x * weeks_in_a_month    # Correction as [weeks old] - [preterm weeks]   corrected_weeks <- weeks_old - y    # Then change back to months the corrected age   corrected_monts <- corrected_weeks / weeks_in_a_month    # Finally, return the rounded values   round(corrected_monts) }  # Compute the column with the corrected age using previous function dataset[, edad_corregida_meses := edad_corregida(edad_cronologica_meses, semanas_prematurez)]

what: Data from the ASQ-3 study from CADI-UMAG — dataset
title: Data from the ASQ-3 study from CADI-UMAG — dataset
Data from the ASQ-3 study from CADI-UMAG — dataset
Data from the ASQ-3 study from CADI-UMAG — dataset
text: data frame 1266 rows y 52 variables: profesional_id: Numeric. Identifying number assessing professional. profesional_especialidad: Character. Profession professional evaluator. paciente_id: Numeric. Patient identifier number. respondedor_vinculo: Character. Type relationship respondent patient. evaluacion_tipo: Numeric. Type assessment. fecha_evaluacion: Date. Date patient assessment. fecha_nacimiento: Date. Patient's date birth. edad_cronologica_meses: Numeric. Chronological age patient months. semanas_prematurez: Numeric. Weeks prematurity. edad_corregida_meses: Numeric. Chronological age patient months corrected weeks prematurity. diagnostico: Character. Patient's diagnostic group. asq3_meses: Numeric. Age months patient development according ASQ 3. comunicacion_q1 - comunicacion_q6: Numeric. Scoring individual questions communication item. comunicacion_total: Numeric. Total score communication item. comunicacion_interpretacion: Character. Interpretation communication item. motora_gruesa_q1 - motora_gruesa_q6: Numeric. Scoring individual questions gross motor skills item. motora_gruesa_total: Numeric. Total score gross motor skills item. motora_gruesa_interpretacion: Character. Interpretation gross motor skills item. motora_fina_q1 - motora_fina_q6: Numeric. Scoring individual questions fine motor skills item. motora_fina_total: Numeric. Total score fine motor skills item. motora_fina_interpretacion: Character. Interpretation fine motor skills item. resolucion_problemas_q1 - resolucion_problemas_q6: Numeric. Scoring individual questions problem solving item. resolucion_problemas_total: Numeric. Total score problem solving item. resolucion_problemas_interpretacion: Character. Interpretation problem solving item. socio_individual_q1 - socio_individual_q6: Numeric. Scoring individual questions socio-individual skills item. socio_individual_total: Numeric. Total score socio-individual skills item. socio_individual_interpretacion: Character. Interpretation socio-individual skills item.

title: Data from the ASQ-3 study from CADI-UMAG — dataset
Data from the ASQ-3 study from CADI-UMAG — dataset
text: Ages & Stages Questionnaires, Third Edition (ASQ-3) developmental screening tool pinpoints developmental progress children ages one month 5.5 years. information please see homepage questionnaire ASQ-3.
